abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, a highly likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. Lessons learned suggest
            the following. The provision of timely and sufficient
            technical assistance (TA) was part of the strategy for the
            financial sector reform program, which was instrumental in
            supporting the project preparation and implementation,
            whose. The early availability of these resources facilitated
            the design of an operation with strong up-front
            conditionality, and, also served to reinforce the
            Government's commitment to the program. The attention
            paid to project design led to development of a challenging
            program with realistic outcomes, focusing the program on
            capacity building and implementation. This focus also proved
            helpful in keeping the reform program on track, as it
            facilitated good measurement of achievements over time.
            Moreover, although synergies can be realized by involving
            other members of the Bank Group, extra care needs to be
            taken in project design to avoid real and perceived
            conflicts of interest: while retaining the Insurance
            Institute of Albania (INSIG) in the program was important
            for the overall development of the financial sector, the
            Bank's options in pursuing conditionality related to
            INSIG were limited, as a potential conflict of interest
            could have resulted from IFC's eventual privatization investment.
